article.headline: Honeywell's stock rallies after profit, sales fall less than expected
article.body: Shares of Honeywell International Inc. HON, +0.34% rallied 1.4% in premarket trading Friday, after the diversified industrial company reported second-quarter profit and sales that fell, but beat expectations. The company said it expects sales challenges resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic will continue, particularly in the aerospace and oil and gas businesses. Net income dropped to $1.08 billion, or $1.53 a share, from $1.54 billion, or $2.10 a share, in the year-ago period. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share came to $1.26, above the FactSet consensus of $1.21. Sales fell 19% to $7.48 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $7.29 billion. Aerospace sales declined 28% to $2.54 billion, but topped the FactSet consensus of $2.41 billion; performance materials and technologies sales declined 19% to $2.22 billion but topped expectations of $2.19 billion; safety and productivity sales slipped 1% to $1.54 billion to beat expectations of $1.43 billion; and building technologies sales shed 19% to $1.18 billion, missing expectations of $1.24 billion. The stock has declined 13.2% year to date through Thursday, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% has lost 6.6%.
